```{r}
# Define the survival functions
NormalSurvival <- function(x) 1 - pnorm(x, mean = 0, sd = 1)
TSurvival <- function(x) 1 - pt(x, df = 2)

# Survival function for value 10
normal_survival_at_10 <- NormalSurvival(10)
t_survival_at_10 <- TSurvival(10)

# Defining Bayes' theorem in R function format
bayes_theorem <- function(P_Gaussian) {
    
    # Calculating the conditional probabilities using Bayes' theorem
    numerator = normal_survival_at_10 * P_Gaussian
    denominator = (normal_survival_at_10 * P_Gaussian) +
                  (t_survival_at_10 * (1 - P_Gaussian))
    
    # Returning the probability P[Event | Gaussian]
    P_Event_given_Gaussian = numerator / denominator
    
    # Formulate the output as per the given equation structure
    list(P_Gaussian = P_Gaussian,
         eq2 = P_Event_given_Gaussian)
}

# Defining the different probabilities for P[Gaussian]
p_gaussian_values <- c(0.5, 0.999, 0.9999, 0.99999, 0.999999, 1)

# Create and print the table
table_results <- sapply(p_gaussian_values, bayes_theorem, simplify = FALSE)

# Convert to dataframe for pretty printing
table_df <- do.call(rbind.data.frame, table_results)

# Print the table
print(table_df)
```
